required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sitagliptin Versus Glipizide in Participants With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Chronic Renal Insufficiency (MK-0431-063 AM1)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Sitagliptin Versus Glipizide in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Chronic Renal Insufficiency Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare how sitagliptin and glipizide lower blood glucose levels in participants with moderate or severe renal insufficiency.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (A1C) Levels at Week 54
primary_outcome.description: A1C represents percentage of glycosylated hemoglobin.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hypoglycemic Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days following the last dose of study therapy
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with at least one symptomatic hypoglycemic adverse event, excluding data after initiation of glycemic rescue therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 54
Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 54

intervention.description: Participants with moderate renal insufficiency will receive two sitagliptin 25 mg tablets orally daily; participants with severe renal insufficiency will receive one sitagliptin 25 mg tablet orally daily
Participants will receive glipizide 2.5 mg (1/2 tablet) orally once daily up to 20 mg orally daily (10 mg twice daily)

Participants with moderate renal insufficiency will receive 2 placebo for sitagliptin tablets orally daily; participants with severe renal insufficiency will receive 1 placebo for sitagliptin tablet orally daily
Participants will receive 1/2 tablet of placebo for glipizide orally once daily up to 2 tablets orally twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Has moderate or severe renal insufficiency
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has type 1 diabetes mellitus or a history of ketoacidosis
- Is on a new weight loss program
- Has active liver disease
- Is on dialysis or is likely to need dialysis during the study

results_reference.citation: Arjona Ferreira JC, Marre M, Barzilai N, Guo H, Golm GT, Sisk CM, Kaufman KD, Goldstein BJ. Efficacy and safety of sitagliptin versus glipizide in patients with type 2 diabetes and moderate-to-severe chronic renal insufficiency. Diabetes Care. 2013 May;36(5):1067-73. doi: 10.2337/dc12-1365. Epub 2012 Dec 17.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: One site was identified as non-compliant with some of the requirements of Good Clinical Practice. For this reason, data from the 3 participants randomized at this site were deemed unreliable and were removed from all analyses.

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Participants randomized to 25 or 50 mg of sitagliptin orally daily + placebo for glipizide

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: Participants randomized to glipizide 2.5 to 20 mg orally daily + placebo for sitagliptin

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Participants randomized to 25 or 50 mg of sitagliptin orally daily + placebo for glipizide

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: Participants randomized to glipizide 2.5 to 20 mg orally daily + placebo for sitagliptin

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (A1C) Levels at Week 54
outcome.description: A1C represents percentage of glycosylated hemoglobin.
outcome.population: The per protocol population required that a participant had measurements both at baseline and at Week 54, and did not have any major protocol violations (e.g. drug compliance <75%, addition of prohibited antihyperglycemic agent, or incorrect double-blind study medication). No missing data were imputed.

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Participants received 25 or 50 mg of sitagliptin orally daily + placebo for glipizide

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: Participants received glipizide 2.5 to 20 mg orally daily + placebo for sitagliptin

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (A1C) Levels at Week 54
measure.description: A1C represents percentage of glycosylated hemoglobin.
measure.population: The per protocol population required that a participant had measurements both at baseline and at Week 54, and did not have any major protocol violations (e.g. drug compliance <75%, addition of prohibited antihyperglycemic agent, or incorrect double-blind study medication). No missing data were imputed.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The pre-specified non-inferiority margin was 0.4%; i.e., non-inferiority required that the upper boundary of the 95% confidence interval for the treatment difference (sitagliptin minus glipizide) to be less than 0.4%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Based on analysis of covariance with terms for treatment, renal insufficiency stratum at Visit 4/Week -2 (moderate, or severe), prior diabetes pharmacotherapy (on or not on oral antihyperglycemic agent), and a covariate for baseline A1C.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Hypoglycemic Events
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with at least one symptomatic hypoglycemic adverse event, excluding data after initiation of glycemic rescue therapy.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days following the last dose of study therapy
outcome.population: All participants as treated (APaT) population included all randomized participants who took at least one dose of study therapy.

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Participants received 25 or 50 mg of sitagliptin orally daily + placebo for glipizide

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: Participants received glipizide 2.5 to 20 mg orally daily + placebo for sitagliptin

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Hypoglycemic Events
measure.description: Percentage of participants with at least one symptomatic hypoglycemic adverse event, excluding data after initiation of glycemic rescue therapy.
measure.population: All participants as treated (APaT) population included all randomized participants who took at least one dose of study therapy.

analysis.estimate_desc: Miettirnen & Nurminen method stratified by renal insufficiency stratum at Visit 4/Week -2 (moderate or severe) & prior diabetes pharmacotherapy

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 54
outcome.population: The per protocol population required that a participant had measurements both at baseline and at Week 54, and did not have any major protocol violations (e.g. drug compliance <75%, addition of prohibited antihyperglycemic agent, or incorrect double-blind study medication). No missing data were imputed.

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Participants received 25 or 50 mg of sitagliptin orally daily + placebo for glipizide

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: Participants received glipizide 2.5 to 20 mg orally daily + placebo for sitagliptin

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 54
measure.population: The per protocol population required that a participant had measurements both at baseline and at Week 54, and did not have any major protocol violations (e.g. drug compliance <75%, addition of prohibited antihyperglycemic agent, or incorrect double-blind study medication). No missing data were imputed.

analysis.estimate_desc: Analysis of covariance with terms for treatment, renal insufficiency stratum at Visit 4/Week -2 (moderate or severe), prior diabetes pharmacotherapy (on or not on oral antihyperglycemic agent), and a covariate for baseline Fasting Plasma Glucose.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 54
outcome.population: All participants as treated (APaT) population included participants who had both baseline and Week 54 data (excluding data after initiation of glycemic rescue therapy).

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Participants received 25 or 50 mg of sitagliptin orally daily + placebo for glipizide

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: Participants received glipizide 2.5 to 20 mg orally daily + placebo for sitagliptin

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 54
measure.population: All participants as treated (APaT) population included participants who had both baseline and Week 54 data (excluding data after initiation of glycemic rescue therapy).

analysis.estimate_desc: Analysis of covariance with terms of treatment, renal insufficiency stratum at Visit 4/Week -2 (moderate or severe), prior diabetes pharmacotherapy (on or not on oral antihyperglycemic agent), and a covariate for baseline body weight.

reported_events.desc: One participant from the sitagliptin group did not receive any study medication and, therefore, was excluded from all analyses. Analyses of safety used the APaT population (participants who had both baseline and Week 54 data, and for serious adverse events only, included data after the initiation of glycemic rescue therapy).

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Participants received 25 or 50 mg of sitagliptin orally daily + placebo for glipizide

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: Participants received glipizide 2.5 to 20 mg orally daily + placebo for sitagliptin

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage unspecified

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the Sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
